post_text:
Thank you to St. Charles City Firefighter Community Outreach for their amazing and generous donation of $1,000 to help purchase food for those most in need. This crisis has been particularly harmful to our most vulnerable population and having community resources such as the St. Charles City Firefighter Community Outreach help out is a blessing!

We'd like to also thank Midtown Market IGA for their partnership in helping us obtain food for our families. We love the community support!

If you'd like to help our cause, stop by the courtesy counter at Midtown and providing the donation earmarked for NHNSC.

post_text:
Wanting to make a difference in your community, but aren't sure where to start? The Neighbor Helping Neighbor Service Coalition is offering a training course for community members to become Volunteer Service Coordinators.

Attendees will learn how to work with families in hardship, assess their needs and learn to create life plans to help get underprivileged families back on track.

Please see the flier below for the full training details. For questions, contact Matt Miller at mmiller@calvaryonline.cc. We hope to see you at the training!

post_text:
On Wednesday, July 25, from 9-10:30 AM, NHNSC will be celebrating 5 years of service to the St. Charles community. We're inviting the entire community to join in this celebration as we'll recount our roots and share our vision for the future.

To RSVP, contact Matt Miller at mmiller@calvaryonine.cc or call 636-939-4343 x1157. We hope to see you there!

post_text: The Neighbor Helping Neighbor Service Coalition held our 4 year anniversary celebration today at the Benton Amin Center. It was wonderful to see so many caring individuals and organizations come together to make real difference in the lives of St. Charles citizens. Can't wait 'til next year!

post_text: The Neighbor Helping Neighbor Service Coalition will be celebrating its four year anniversary on Thursday, May 11, from 9-11 am. We welcome members from the community to join us in this celebration of service to St. Charles. See below for full event and RSPV details. We hope to see you there!
text: The Neighbor Helping Neighbor Service Coalition will be celebrating its four year anniversary on Thursday, May 11, from 9-11 am. We welcome members from the community to join us in this celebration of service to St. Charles. See below for full event and RSPV details. We hope to see you there!

post_text:
The Neighbor Helping Neighbor Service Coalition is excited to announce our four year anniversary celebration event. It is scheduled for Thursday May 11, 2017 9:00 to 10:00 am at the City of St. Charles School District Central Office, 400 N. Sixth Street.

Please celebrate with us how this wonderful community has come together to bring comprehensive care to hurting families, provided thousands of supplies to school-aged children and volunteered countless hours of service for the greater good.

See below for the full details on the event. We hope to see you there!

Please celebrate with us how this wonderful community has come together to bring comprehensive care to hurting families, provided thousands of supplies to school-aged children and volunteered countless hours of service for the greater good.

See below for the full details on the event. We hope to see you there!

post_text: NHNSC would like to send out a big thank you the St. Charles Jaycees for donating around 50 winter coats for students in need in the St. Charles School District! Chapter president Drew Weber stopped by the Benton Admin Center to drop off the coats today. Blessed to be apart of a wonderful, supportive community!

See the flier below for more information or contact Todd Barnes at 636-978-2277 with any questions.

post_text:
Neighbor Helping Neighbor Service Coalition seeks to help hurting families in our community. We aim to do so via school resource systems and a comprehensive support system that involves crisis response, short-term support and lifetime engagement.

To help illustrate how our coalition works, we've created the graphics below to help visualize our system.

For questions about NHNSC, please contact Matt Miller at mmiller@calvaryonline.cc.

post_text:
Today, the Neighbor Helping Neighbor Service Coalition received a 2016 Community Builder Award from the Community Council of St. Charles. It is a honor to be recognized by such a wonderful organization that works tirelessly on the betterment of St. Charles County.

Congratulations to the other recipients, Habitat for Humanity of St. Charles County, ITN-St. Charles, Walking for Wellness: Stop Heroin and Steve Collier, on being recognized for the wonderful, important work they do in our community.
text:
Today, the Neighbor Helping Neighbor Service Coalition received a 2016 Community Builder Award from the Community Council of St. Charles. It is a honor to be recognized by such a wonderful organization that works tirelessly on the betterment of St. Charles County.

Congratulations to the other recipients, Habitat for Humanity of St. Charles County, ITN-St. Charles, Walking for Wellness: Stop Heroin and Steve Collier, on being recognized for the wonderful, important work they do in our community.

post_text:
The Neighbor Helping Neighbor Service Coalition is honored to announce that it has been selected as a recipient of the 2016 Community Builder Award from the Community Council of St. Charles County!

It is a great honor to be recognized as an organization that strives to "build a stronger, healthier, more compassionate community." We will continue to do our best to help end the cycle of poverty for citizens in St. Charles County.

NHNSC members will officially accept the award during Community Builders Awards luncheon being held on June 2 at the Old Hickory Golf Club.
text:
The Neighbor Helping Neighbor Service Coalition is honored to announce that it has been selected as a recipient of the 2016 Community Builder Award from the Community Council of St. Charles County!

It is a great honor to be recognized as an organization that strives to "build a stronger, healthier, more compassionate community." We will continue to do our best to help end the cycle of poverty for citizens in St. Charles County.

NHNSC members will officially accept the award during Community Builders Awards luncheon being held on June 2 at the Old Hickory Golf Club.
